content: Maciej Pirog | Department of Computer Science Skip to main content University of Oxford Department of Computer Science HomeAbout UsPeopleStudentsMaciej PirogMaciej Pirog Maciej Pirog Doctoral StudentStudent, Kellogg CollegeLeaving date: 31st July 2015Themes:Programming LanguagesCompleted Projects:more…See Also:My blog (maciejcs)Commutative diagram of the dayInterestsI enjoy formal semantics of programming languages and interactive theorem proving in Coq. At the moment, I am working on modelling effects (like I/O) in type theory.BiographyI came to the city of dreaming spires straight from Wroclaw, Poland, where I graduated from the local university. I was awarded the title of MSc in computer science, and my thesis was entitled Toward a certified Haskell compiler: Correctness and implementation of the Spineless Tagless G-machine verified in the Coq proof assistant (I really enjoyed the length of the title at that time). Now, I am working hard to become a doctor of philosophy.Selected PublicationsView AllManage publications From Push/Enter to Eval/Apply by Program Transformation Maciej Piróg and Jeremy Gibbons In Olivier Danvy and Ugo de'Liguoro, editors, Proceedings of the Workshop on Continuations. Vol. 212 of Electronic Proceedings in Theoretical Computer Science. Pages 53−62. June, 2016.
